title: Maybe off topic. "Service Recommended" Warning on Big Sur after new battery installation.
message: I have been successfully replacing batteries using "Original" Apple parts on several models of A1502, A1398, A1466 MacBooks. Systems that are running macOS 11 Big Sur are now reporting a "Service Recommended" warning in the menubar after installation. Booting into older OS (High Sierra, Mojave, Catalina) do not give this error. Is there any way to rectify this issue?

title: Maybe off topic. "Service Recommended" Warning on Big Sur after new battery installation.
Maybe off topic. "Service Recommended" Warning on Big Sur after new battery installation.
message: Did PRAM reset, SMC reset, completely drain and then charge to full overnight, SMC reset again, PRAM reset again. No change.

title: Maybe off topic. "Service Recommended" Warning on Big Sur after new battery installation.
message:
Some people claim the Big Sur last version solved the bug...

title: Maybe off topic. "Service Recommended" Warning on Big Sur after new battery installation.
message: This system is running 11.4, which I believe is the newest version. SMC and PRAM reset apparently works with 2016/2017 MBP but this is an older L2013 A1398.
